aslib.fx.util

Class Alerts

  • java.lang.Object
    • aslib.fx.util.Alerts

  • public class Alerts
extends java.lang.Object

    Abstracts the creation of objects of type Alert.

    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    2019-05-03
    Author:
    Adriano Siqueira

    • Constructor Detail

      • Alerts

        public Alerts(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type,
              java.lang.String title,
              java.lang.String content)

        Creates an instance of Alerts class.

        The header of dialog will be empty and the default buttons selection will be used.

        Parameters:
        type - Type of the message.
        title - Title of the dialog.
        content - Content of the dialog.

      • Alerts

        public Alerts(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type,
              java.lang.String title,
              java.lang.String header,
              java.lang.String content)

        Creates an instance of Alerts class.

        The default buttons selection will be used.

        Parameters:
        type - Type of the message.
        title - Title of the dialog.
        header - Header of the dialog, shown above of content.
        content - Content of the dialog.

      • Alerts

        public Alerts(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type,
              java.lang.String title,
              java.lang.String header,
              java.lang.String content,
              javafx.scene.control.ButtonType[] buttons)

        Creates an instance of Alerts class.

        Parameters:
        type - Type of the message.
        title - Title of the dialog.
        header - Header of the dialog, shown above of content.
        content - Content of the dialog.
        buttons - Buttons that will be present in the dialog.

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()

        Shows the dialog. As this dialog is show in background, the result value is not caught.

      • showAndWait

        public javafx.scene.control.ButtonType showAndWait()

        Shows the dialog and pauses the execution.

        Returns:
        The pressed button.

      • getAlert

        private javafx.scene.control.Alert getAlert()

        Creates an Alert object with the provided information.

        Returns:
        A complete alert ready to be used.
